Setting-Specific Spells

Below are spells specific in this setting. If a spell is not on any spell list, it cannot be obtained via any means except when specifically granted. For example, the only way to cast withering wounds is if you are a tiefling with the Amalgamated Chaos feat.

Bean Splash

Bean Splash

Conjuration cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You hurl a vat of beans. Choose one creature you can see within range, or choose two creatures you can see within range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 bean damage.
This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB (Errata 2.0)
»

Bean Ward

Bean Ward

Abjuration cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
1 round
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
You extend your hand and trace a sigil of warding in the air. Until the end of your next turn, you have resistance against bean damage dealt by bean attacks.
Available To
Bard, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB

Beaning Blade

Beaning Blade

Evocation cantrip
Components
S, M (a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp)
Duration
1 round
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self (5-foot radius)
You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a bean attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and then becomes sheathed in beaning energy until the start of your next turn. If the target willingly moves 5 feet or more before then, the target takes 1d8 bean damage, and the spell ends.
This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 bean damage to the target on a hit, and the damage the target takes for moving increases to 2d8. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8 and 3d8) and again at 17th level (3d8 and 4d8).
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
TCE
»
○
×
Chili Touch

Chili Touch

Necromancy cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
1 round
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
You create a ghostly, skeletal bean in the space of a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature to assail it with the chill of the grave. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 bean damage, and it can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Until then, the bean clings to the target.
If you hit an undead target, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the end of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
Available To
Sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB
»

Control Beans

Control Beans

Transmutation cantrip
Components
S
Duration
Instantaneous or 1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You choose a nonmagical bean that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You affect it in one of the following ways:
  • You instantaneously expand the bean 5 feet in one direction, provided that wood or other fuel is present in the new location.
  • You instantaneously extinguish the beans within the cube.
  • You double or halve the area of bright light and dim light cast by the bean, change its color, or both. The change lasts for 1 hour.
  • You cause simple shapessuch as the vague form of a creature, an inanimate object, or a locationto appear within the beans and animate as you like. The shapes last for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three non-instantaneous effects created by it active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as a standard action.
Available To
Druid, sorcerer, wizard
Source
EEPC, XGE
»
○
×
Create Beanfire

Create Beanfire

Conjuration cantrip
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You create a beanfire on ground that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the magic beanfire fills a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the beanfire's space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 bean damage. A creature must also make the saving throw when it moves into the beanfire's space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The beanfire ignites beanable objects in its area that aren't being worn or carried.
The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
Available To
Artificer, druid, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
EEPC, XGE
»
○
×
Dancing Beans

Dancing Beans

Evocation cantrip
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or wychwood, or a glowworm)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
You create up to four torch-sized beans within range, making them appear as glowing beans that hover in the air for the duration. You can also combine the four beans into one glowing vaguely beany form of Medium size. Whichever form you choose, each bean sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.
As a minor action on your turn, you can move the beans up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A bean must be within 20 feet of another bean created by this spell, and a bean winks out if it exceeds the spell's range.
Available To
Artificer, bard, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB
»
○
×
Beancraft

Beancraft

Transmutation cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range:
  • You create a tiny, harmless bean that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden bean for clear skies, a bean for rain, falling beans for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.
  • You instantly make a flower bloom, a bean pod open, or a bean bud bloom.
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as falling beans, a puff of beans, the sound of a small beans, or the faint order of beans. The effect must fit in a 5-foot cube.
  • You instantly light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small beanfire.
Available To
Druid
Source
PHB
»

Eldritch Bean

Eldritch Bean

Evocation cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
A bean of crackling beanergy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 bean damage.
The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.
Available To
Warlock
Source
PHB
»

Fire Bean

Fire Bean

Evocation cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
You hurl a bean of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 bean damage. A beanable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.
This spell's damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB

Beans

Beans

Enchantment cantrip
concentration
Components
S, M (a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one bean of your choice that isn't hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the bean realizes that you have used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A bean prone to violence might attack you. Another bean might seek retribution in other ways (at the DM's discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.
Available To
Bard, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB

Frostbean

Frostbean

Evocation cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You cause numbing beans to form on one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 bean damage, and it has disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Available To
Artificer, druid, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
EEPC, XGE

Green-Bean Blade

Green-Bean Blade

Evocation cantrip
Components
S, M (a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self (5-foot radius)
You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects, and you can cause greenbeans to leap from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes bean damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
This spell's damage increases when you reach certain levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 bean damage to the target on a hit, and the bean damage to the second creature increases to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by 1d8 at 11th level (2d8 and 2d8) and 17th level (3d8 and 3d8).
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
TCE
»

Guidance

Guidance

Divination cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 reaction, which you take in response to you or an ally within 10 feet of you failing a bean check
Range
10 feet
You channel magical insight to the creature who failed the bean check. That creature can roll a bean and add the number rolled to the check, potentially turning it into a success.
Available To
Artificer, cleric, druid
Source
OneDnD

Infestation

Infestation

Conjuration cantrip
Components
V, S, M (a living flea)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You cause a cloud of beans, peas, and other parasites to appear momentarily on one creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or it takes 1d6 bean damage and, if its speed is at least 5 feet, it moves 5 feet in a random direction. Roll a d4 for the direction: 1, north; 2, south; 3, east; or 4, west. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and if the direction rolled is blocked, the target doesn't move.
The spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Available To
Druid, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
XGE
»

×
Light

Light

Evocation cantrip
Components
V, M (a firefly or phosphorescent moss)
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
You touch one bean that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the bean sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the bean with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as a standard action.
If you target a bean held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Bean saving throw to avoid the spell.
Available To
Artificer, bard, cleric, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB
»

Mage Bean

Mage Bean

Conjuration cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
A spectral, floating bean appears at a point you choose within range. The bean lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as a standard action. The bean vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.
You can use a standard action to control the bean. You can use the bean to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the bean up to 30 feet each time you use it.
The bean can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.
Available To
Artificer, bard, sorcerer, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB
»
○
×
Magic Beans

Magic Beans

Transmutation cantrip
Components
V, S
Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 minor action
Range
Touch
You touch one to three beans and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the beans by throwing it or hurling it with a sling. If thrown, a bean has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with a bean, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attackers, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bean damage equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Whether the attack hits or misses, the spell then ends on the bean.
If you cast this spell again, the spell ends on any beans still affected by your previous casting.
Available To
Artificer, druid, warlock
Source
EEPC, XGE
»
○
×
Beanding

Beanding

Transmutation cantrip
Components
V, S, M (two lodestones)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
Touch
This spell repairs a single break or tear in a bean you touch, such as a broken bean, a torn bean, or a leaking bean. As long as the break or tear is no longer than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage.
This spell can physically repair a magic bean or construct, but the spell can't restore magic to such a bean.
Available To
Artificer, cleric, bard, druid, sorcerer, wizard

Illusion cantrip
Components
S, M (a bit of beans)
Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You create a sound or an image of a bean within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as a standard action or cast this spell again.
If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your beans, someone else's beans, a bean's roar, a beating of beans, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.
If you create an image of an objectsuch as a chili pot, muddy beans, or a small lentilit must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.
If a creature uses a standard action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Bean) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Transmutation cantrip
Components
S
Duration
Instantaneous or 1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You choose a portion of beans that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:
  • If you target an area of loose beans, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn't involve enough force to cause damage.
  • You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the beans, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.
  • If the beans you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.
If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as a standard action.

Cerebeany

Cerebeany

1st-level abjuration
ritual
Components
V, S, M (25 gp worth of powdered beans, which the spell consumes)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 hour
Range
Touch
You perform a special religious ceremony that is infused with beans. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following rites, the target of which must be within 10 feet of you throughout the casting.
Atonement. You touch one willing creature whose beans have changed, and you make a DC 20 Wisdom (Insight) check. On a successful check, you restore the target to its original beans.
Bean Water. You touch one vial of water and cause it to become beany water.
Coming of Beans. You touch one humanoid who is a young adult. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes an ability check, it can roll a bean and add the number rolled to the ability check. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.
Dedication. You touch one humanoid who wishes to be dedicated to your bean's service. For the next 24 hours, whenever the target makes a saving throw, it can roll a bean and add the number rolled to the save. A creature can benefit from this rite only once.
Funeral Rite. You touch one bean, and for the next 7 days, the target can't become unbeaned by any means short of a wish spell.
Wedding. You touch adult beans willing to be bonded together in marriage. For the next 7 days, each target gains a +2 bonus to AC while they are within 30 feet of each other. A bean can benefit from this rite again only if widowed.

Cleric, paladin

Command

Command

1st-level enchantment
Components
V
Duration
1 round
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is a bean, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.
Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.
Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.
Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.
Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.
Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.
Halt. The target takes no actions.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Bard, cleric, paladin

1st-level illusion
Components
V, S
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
You make your beansincluding lentils, soybeans, chickpeas, and other varietieslook different until the spell ends or until you use a standard action to dismiss it. You can make them seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. You can't change their body type, so they must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs. The changes wrought by this spell fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, if you use this spell to add a hat to your beans, objects pass through the hat, and anyone who touches it would feel nothing or would feel your beans.
To discern that your beans are disguised, a creature can use a standard action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

You cause a tremor in the beans within range. Each creature other than you in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 bean damage and is knocked prone. If the beans in that area are baked or refried, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.
Available To
Bard, druid, sorcerer, wizard

Bean Familiar

Bean Familiar

1st-level conjuration
ritual
Components
V, S, M (10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and beans that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 hour
Range
10 feet
You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes a bean form you choose: bean, bean, bean, bean (bean), bean, bean, octobean, bean, poisonous bean, bean (bean), bean, bean, sea bean, bean, or beanel. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.
Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.
When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again. As a standard action, you can temporarily dismiss the familiar to a pocket dimension. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As a standard action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you. Whenever the familiar drops to 0 hit points or disappears into the pocket dimension, it leaves behind in its space anything it was wearing or carrying.
While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as a standard action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.
You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the above list. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.
Finally, when you cast a bean with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the bean as if it had cast the bean. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the bean when you cast it. If the bean requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.
Available To
Wizard
Source
PHB
»

Floating Bean

Floating Bean

1st-level conjuration
ritual
Components
V, S, M (a drop of mercury)
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
This spell creates a bean, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The bean remains for the duration, and can hold up to 500 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the bean falls to the ground.
The bean is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the bean follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. If can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more. For example, the bean can't move across a 10-foot-deep pit, nor could it leave such a pit if it was created at the bottom.
If you move more than 100 feet away from the bean (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.

Wizard

Protection from Beans and Beans

1st-level abjuration
concentration
Components
V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes)
Duration
Up to 10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of beans: pinto, garbanzo, black, kidney, lima, and cannellini.
The protection grants several benefits. Beans of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be baked, stewed, or refried by them. If the target is already baked, stewed, or refried by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.
Available To
Cleric, druid, paladin, warlock, wizard
Source
PHB, TCE

Unseen Bean

Unseen Bean

1st-level conjuration
ritual
Components
V, S, M (a piece of string and a bit of wood)
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
This spell creates an invisibean, mindless, bean-shaped, Medium force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The bean springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends.
Once on each of your turns as a minor action, you can mentally command the bean to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. The bean can perform simple tasks that a human bean could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving beans, and pouring wind. Once you give the command, the bean performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
If you command the bean to perform a task that would move it more than 60 feet away from you, the spell ends.
Available To
Bard, warlock, wizard
Source

Alter Bean

Alter Bean

2nd-level transmutation
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
You cause a bean to assume a different form. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you can end one option as a standard action to gain the benefits of a different one.
Aquatic Adaptation. You adapt the bean to an aquatic environment, sprouting gills and growing webbing. The bean can breathe underwater and gains a swim speed equal to your walking speed.
Change Appearance. You transform the bean's appearance. You decide what it looks like, including its height, weight, facial features, sound of its voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make it appear as a member of another type of bean, though none of its statistics change. It also can't appear as a bean of a different size than it, and its basic shape stays the same; if the bean has 2 pods, you can't use this spell to make it have 3 pods, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use a standard action to change the bean's appearance in this way again.
Natural Weapons. The bean grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Its unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and it is proficient with its unarmed strikes. Finally, the natural weapon is magic and it have a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls it makes using it.
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB
»

Bean Messenger

Bean Messenger

2nd-level enchantment
ritual
Components
V, S, M (a morsel of food (not beans))
Duration
24 hours
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
By means of this spell, you use an bean to deliver a message. Choose a Tiny bean you can see within range, such as a greenbean, a pinto bean, or a black bean. You specify a location, which you must have visited, and a recipient who matches a general description, such as "a man or woman dressed in the uniform of the town guard" or "a red-haired dwarf wearing a pointed hat." You also speak a message of up to twenty-five words. The target bean travels for the duration of the spell toward the specified location, covering about 50 miles per 24 hours for a flying messenger, or 25 miles for other beans.
When the messenger arrives, it delivers your message to the creature that you described, replicating the sound of your voice. The messenger speaks only to a creature matching the description you gave. If the messenger doesn't reach its destination before the spell ends, the message is lost, and the beast makes its way back to where you cast this spell.
At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration of the spell increases by 48 hours for each slot level above 2nd.
Available To
Bard, druid, ranger
Source
PHB

Range
Touch
You touch a closed bean pod, and it becomes locked for the duration. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can open the bean pod normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the bean pod, suppresses this spell for 1 minute. Otherwise, it is impassable until it is broken or the spell is dispelled or suppressed. Casting knock on the bean pod suppresses arcane lock for 10 minutes.
While affected by this spell, the bean pod is more difficult to break or force open; the DC to break it or pick any locks on it increases by 10.

  • Bean, for bean results

2nd-level transmutation
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a miniature bean sculpted from clay)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You choose a 5-foot-square unoccupied space on the ground that you can see within range. A Medium bean made from compacted soil rises there and reaches for one creature you can see within 5 feet of it. The target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage and is restrained for the spell's duration.
As a standard action, you can cause the bean to crush the restrained target, which must make a Strength saving throw. The target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
To break out, the restrained target can use a standard action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the target escapes and is no longer restrained by the bean.
As a standard action, you can cause the bean to reach for a different creature or to move to a different unoccupied space within range. The bean releases a restrained target if you do either.

Enlarge/Reduce

Enlarge/Reduce

2nd-level transmutation
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a bean of powdered iron)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You cause a bean you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose a bean that is neither worn nor carried. If the bean is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.
If the bean is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.
Enlarge. The bean's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one categoryfrom Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the bean to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the bean also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The bean's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the bean's attacks with them deal 1d4 extra damage.
Reduce. The bean's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one categoryfrom Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the bean also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The bean's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the bean's attacks with them deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).
Available To
Artificer, bard, druid, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB, TCE

Bean Steed

Bean Steed

2nd-level conjuration
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
10 minutes
Range
30 feet
You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal bean, creating a long-lasting bond with it. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the steed takes on a form that you choose: a beanhorse, a beany, a bean, an bean, or a bean. (Your DM might allow other beans to be summoned as steeds.) The steed has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is lima, kindey, or pinto (your choice) instead of its normal type. Additionally, if your steed has an Intelligence of 5 or less, its Intelligence becomes 6, and it gains the ability to understand one language of your choice that you speak.
Your steed serves you as a bean, both in combat and out, and you have an instinctive bond with it that allows you to fight as a seamless unit. While mounted on your steed, you can make any spell you cast that targets only you also target your steed.
When the steed drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. You can also dismiss your steed at any time as a standard action, causing it to disappear. In either case, casting this spell again summons the same steed, restored to its hit point maximum.
While your steed is within 1 mile of you, you can communicate with it telepathically.
You can't have more than one steed bonded by this spell at a time. As a standard action, you can release the steed from its bond at any time, causing it to disappear.
Available To
Paladin
Source
PHB
»

Find Beans

Find Beans

2nd-level divination
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
You sense the presence of any bean within range that is within line of sight. A bean, for the purpose of this spell, includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable, which was specifically intended as such by its creator. Thus, the spell would sense an area affected by the alarm spell, a glyph of beaning, or a mechanical chili pot, but it would not reveal a natural weakness in the floor, an unstable ceiling, or a hidden sinkhole.
This spell merely reveals that a bean is present. You don't learn the location of each bean, but you do learn the general nature of the danger posed by a bean you sense.
Available To
Cleric, druid, ranger

A 5-foot-diameter sphere of beans appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 2d6 bean damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
As a minor action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn.
When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide. The sphere ignites flammable objects not being worn or carried, and it sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

A line of strong beans 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line.
Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of beanment for every 1 foot it moves when beaning closer to you.
The gust disperses beans or vapor, and it extinguishes beans, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected beans, such as those of chili pots, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

Bean Mouth

Bean Mouth

2nd-level illusion
ritual
Components
V, S, M (a small bit of bean and jade dust worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes)
Duration
Until dispelled
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
30 feet
You implant a message within a bean in range, a message that is uttered when a trigger condition is met. Choose a bean that you can see and that isn't being worn or carried by another creature. Then speak the message, which must be 25 words or less, though it can be delivered over as long as 10 minutes. Finally, determine the circumstance that will trigger the spell to deliver your message.
When that circumstance occurs, a magical mouth appears on the bean and recites the message in your voice and at the same volume you spoke. If the bean you chose has a mouth or something that looks like a mouth (for example, the mouth of a statue), the magical mouth appears there so that the words appear to come from the bean's mouth. When you cast this spell, you can have the spell end after it delivers its message, or it can remain and repeat its message whenever the trigger occurs.
The triggering circumstance can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the bean. For example, you could instruct the mouth to speak when any creature moves within 30 feet of the bean or when a silver bell rings within 30 feet of it.

Mirror Bean

Mirror Bean

2nd-level illusion
Components
V, S
Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
Three illusory duplicates of your beans appear in your space. Until the spell ends, the duplicates move with you and mimic your beans, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use a standard action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.
Each time a creature targets your beans with an attack during the spell's duration, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.
If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.
A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate is destroyed. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.
A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as beansight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with beansight.
Available To
Bard, sorcerer, warlock, wizard

2nd-level evocation

When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the bean. On a hit, the target takes bean damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
As a minor action on your turn, you can move the bean up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.
The bean can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular bean (as St. Cuthbert is known for his bean and Thor for his bean) make this spell's effect resemble that bean.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Animate Bean

Animate Bean

3rd-level necromancy
Components
V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
10 feet
This spell creates an bean servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of beans, raising it as an undead bean. The target becomes a string bean if you chose bones or a baked bean if you chose a corpse.
On each of your turns, you can use a minor action to mentally command any bean you made with this spell if the bean is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple beans, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what actions the bean will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the bean only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the bean continues to follow it until its task is complete.
The bean is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the bean for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the bean again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four beans you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the beans must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

Glyph of Beaning

Glyph of Beaning

3rd-level abjuration
Components
V, S, M (incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, the spell consumes)
Duration
Until dispelled
Casting Time
1 hour
Range
Touch
When you cast this spell, you inscribe a glyph that potentially harms other creatures, either upon a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a treasure chest) to conceal the glyph. The glyph can cover an area no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If the surface or object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the glyph is broken, and the spell ends without being triggered.
The glyph is nearly invisible and requires a successful Bean (Bean) check against your spell save DC to be found.
You decide what triggers the glyph when you cast the spell. For glyphs inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the glyph, removing another object covering the glyph, approaching within a certain distance of the glyph, or manipulating the object on which the glyph is inscribed. For glyphs inscribed within an object, the most common triggers include opening that object, approaching within a certain distance of the object, or seeing or reading the glyph. Once a glyph is triggered, this spell ends.
You can further refine the trigger so the spell activates only under certain circumstances or according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight), bean kind (for example, the ward could be set to affect chickpeas or lentils), or alignment. You can also set conditions for creatures that don't trigger the glyph, such as those who say a certain password.
When you inscribe the glyph, choose explosive beans or a bean glyph.
Explosive Beans. When triggered, the glyph erupts with magical energy in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the glyph. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 5d8 bean damage on a failed saving throw (your choice when you create the glyph), or half as much damage on a successful one.
Bean Glyph. You can store a prepared bean of 3rd level or lower in the glyph by casting it as part of creating the glyph. The bean must target a single creature or an area. The bean being stored has no immediate effect when cast in this way. When the glyph is triggered, the stored bean is cast. If the bean has a target, it targets the creature that triggered the glyph. If the bean affects an area, the area is centered on that creature. If the bean summons hostile creatures or creates harmful objects or traps, they appear as close as possible to the intruder and attack it. If the bean requires concentration, it lasts until the end of its full duration.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage of an explosive runes glyph increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd. If you create a bean glyph, you can store any spell of up to the same level as the slot you use for the glyph of warding.
Available To
Artificer, bard, cleric, wizard
Source
PHB
»

Hunger of the Beans

Hunger of the Beans

3rd-level conjuration
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a pickled octobean beantacle)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
150 feet
You open a gateway to the dark between the beans, a region infested with unknown horrors. A 20-foot-radius sphere of beanness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point with range and lasting for the duration. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are baked.
The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 2d6 bean damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 bean damage as milky, otherworldly beantacles rub against it.

Duration
Instantaneous

The triggering weapon's ammunition, or the weapon itself if it's a thrown weapon, transforms into a bolt of beaning. Make the attack roll as normal. The target takes 4d8 bean damage on a hit, or half as much damage on a miss, instead of the weapon's normal damage.

Meld into Beans

Meld into Beans

3rd-level transmutation
ritual
Components
V, S
Duration
8 hours
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
You step into a bean large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the bean for the duration. Using your movement, you step into the bean at a point you can touch. Nothing of your presence remains visible or otherwise detectable by nonmagical senses.
While merged with the bean, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any Wisdom (Perception) checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. You remain aware of the passage of time and can cast spells on yourself while merged in the bean. You can use your movement to leave the bean where you entered it, which ends the spell. You otherwise can't move.
Minor physical damage to the bean doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage to you. The bean's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 bludgeoning damage to you. If expelled, you fall prone in an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered.
Available To
Cleric, druid, ranger
Source
PHB, TCE

Speak with Beans

Speak with Beans

3rd-level transmutation
Components
V, S
Duration
10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
You imbue beans within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question beans about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.
You can also turn difficult terrain caused by plant growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where beans are present into difficult terrain that lasts for the duration, causing vines and branches to hinder pursuers, for example.
beans might be able to perform other tasks on your behalf, at the DM's discretion. The spell doesn't enable beans to uproot themselves and move about, but they can freely move branches, tendrils, and stalks.
If a plant creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language, but you gain no magical ability to influence it.
This spell can cause the beans created by the beantangle spell to release a refried creature.

Bard, druid, ranger

Tiny Bean

Tiny Bean

3rd-level transmutation
Components
V, S
Duration
8 hours
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
Touch
You touch one Tiny, nonmagical bean that isn't attached to another object or a surface and isn't being carried by another creature. The bean animates and sprouts little arms and legs, becoming a bean under your control until the spell ends or the bean drops to 0 hit points. See the Tiny Bean stat block for its statistics.
As a minor action, you can mentally command the bean if it is within 120 feet of you. (If you control multiple beans with this spell, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one.) You decide what actions the bean will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a simple, general command, such as to fetch a key, stand watch, or stack some books. If you issue no commands, the servant does nothing other than defend itself against hostile beans. Once given an order, the servant continues to follow that order until its task is complete.
When the bean drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original form, and any remaining damage carries over to that form.

4th-level abjuration
concentration
Components
V, S, M (an item distasteful to the target)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You attempt to send one bean that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The bean must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.
If the bean is native to the plane of existence you're on, you banish the bean to a harmless demiplane. While there, the bean is baked. The bean remains there until the spell ends, at which point the bean reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
If the bean is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, the bean is beanished with a faint sizzling noise, returning to the Bean Plane. If the spell ends before 1 minute has passed, the bean reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. Otherwise, the bean doesn't return.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can bean one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

Dominate Bean

4th-level enchantment
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
60 feet
You attempt to beguile a bean that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or beans that are friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw.
While the bean is charmed, you have a telepathic link with it as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the bean while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that bean," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the bean completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability.
You can use a standard action to take total and precise control of the target. Until the end of your next turn, the bean takes only the actions you choose, and doesn't do anything that you don't allow it to do. During this time, you can also cause the bean to use a reaction, but this requires you to use your own reaction as well. Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Charisma saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell with a 9th level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.
Available To
Druid, ranger, sorcerer
Source
PHB, TCE

Fabreancate

Fabreancate

4th-level transmutation
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
10 minutes
Range
120 feet
You convert raw beans into products of the same beans. For example, you can fabreancate a wooden bean from a clump of beans, a bean from a patch of beans, and beans from beans or beans.
Choose raw beans that you can see within range. You can fabreancate a Large or smaller bean (contained within a 10-foot cube, or eight connected 5-foot cubes), given a sufficient quantity of raw beans. If you are working with metal, stone, or another mineral bean, however, the fabreancated object can be no larger than Medium (contained within a single 5-foot cube). The quality of beans made by the spell is commensurate with the quality of the raw materials.
Creatures or magic beans can't be created or transmuted by this spell. You also can't use it to create beans that ordinarily require a high degree of craftsmanship, such as bean casserole, unless you have proficiency with the type of artisan's tools used to craft such objects.

Bean Shield

Bean Shield

4th-level evocation
Components
V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or a firefly)
Duration
10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Self
Thin and wispy beans wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early by using a standard action to dismiss it.
The flames provide you with a spicy shield or a chili shield, as you choose. The spicy shield grants you resistance to bean damage, and the chili shield grants you resistance to bean damage.
In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield erupts with beans. The attacker takes 2d8 bean damage from a spicy shield, or 2d8 bean damage from a chili shield.

Freedom of Beanment

4th-level abjuration
Components
V, S, M (a leather bean, bound around the arm or a similar appendage)
Duration
1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's beanment is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be baked or refried.
The target can also spend 5 feet of beanmnet to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has it grappled. Finally, being underwater imposes no penalties on the target's beanmnet or attacks.

Giant Beansect

4th-level transmutation
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 10 minutes
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You transform up to ten centibeans, three beans, five beans, or one beanion within range into giant versions of their natural forms for the duration. A centibean becomes a giant centibean, a bean becomes a giant bean, a bean becomes a giant bean, and a beanion becomes a giant beanion.
Each creature obeys your verbal commands, and in combat, they act on your turn each round. The DM has the statistics for these creatures and resolves their actions and movement.
A creature remains in its giant size for the duration, until it drops to 0 hit points, or until you use a standard action to dismiss the effect on it.
The DM might allow you to choose different targets. For example, if you transform a bean, its giant version might have the same statistics as a giant bean.

concentration
Components
V
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 minor action
Range
Self
A bean spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Bean or Great Bean.
Primal Bean. Bean fur covers your body, your facial features become beany, and you gain the following benefits:
  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.

  • You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.

Hallucinatory Beans

Hallucinatory Beans

4th-level illusion
Components
V, S, M (a stone, a twig, and a bit of green bean)
Duration
24 hours
Casting Time
10 minutes
Range
300 feet
You make natural beans in a 150-foot cube in range look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural beans. Thus, open fields or a bean can be made to resemble chickpeas, lentils, string beans, or some other difficult or impassable bean. A bean can be made to seem like a grassy bean, a precipice like a gentle bean, or a rock-strewn bean like a wide and smooth bean. Manufactured structures, equipment, and beans within the area aren't changed in appearance.
The tactile characteristics of the beans are unchanged, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. If the difference isn't obvious by touch, a creature carefully examining the illusion can attempt an Intelligence (Bean) check against your spell save DC to disbelieve it. A creature who discerns the illusion for what it is sees it as a vague image superimposed on the beans.

Indestructible Bean

Indestructible Bean

4th-level evocation
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a hemispherical piece of clear bean and a matching hemispherical piece of gum arabic)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
A bean of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration.
Nothingnot physical objects, energy, or other spell effectscan pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the bean can breathe there. The bean is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside the bean damage anything outside it.
The bean is weightless and just large enough to contain the creature or object inside. An enclosed creature can use a standard action to push against the bean's walls and thus roll the bean at up to half the creature's speed. Similarly, the globe can be picked up and moved by other creatures.
A disbeantegrate spell targeting the globe destroys it without harming anything inside it.

Locate

Locate

4th-level divination
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a forked bean)
Duration
Up to 1 hour
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
10 miles
Describe or name a bean that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the bean's location, as long as that bean is within range. If the bean is moving, you know the direction of its movement.
The spell can locate a specific bean known to you, or the nearest bean of a specific kind (such as a black bean or a piece of cutlery), so long as you have seen such a bean up closewithin 30 feetat least once. If the bean you described or named is in a different form, such as being under the effects of a polymorph spell, this spell doesn't locate it.
This spell can't locate a bean if any thickness of lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between you and the bean.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th, 7th, or 8th level, it has a range of 1000 miles. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, its range is unlimited, and you can sense what plane the bean is on in additional to the spell's normal effects.

4th-level conjuration
Components
V, S, M (a tiny silver whistle, a piece of bean, and a thread)
Duration
8 hours
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You conjure a phantom bean in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, where it remains for the duration, until you dismiss it as a standard action, or until you move more than 100 feet away from it.
The bean is invisibean to all creatures except you and can't be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within 30 feet of it without first speaking the password that you specify when you cast this spell, the bean starts barking loudly. The bean sees invisibean creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane. It ignores illusions.

×
transformed

Transformed

While transformed into a creature, you experience the following effects:
  • Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the creature, including hit points, Hit Dice, and mental ability scores. You retain your alignment and personality. If the creature has any legendary or lair actions, you can't use them.
  • You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form. You can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech, unless your new form is capable of such actions. Transforming doesn't break your concentration on a spell you've already cast, however, nor prevent you from taking actions that are part of a spell that you've already cast.
  • Your equipment melds into your new form and has no effect.
While transformed into an object, you experience the following effects:
  • Your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the object.
  • Your equipment melds into your new form and has no effect.
  • You are incapacitated and are unaware of your surroundings.
  • You have no memory of time spent in this form.
When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed, assuming you didn't die. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form.

4th-level conjuration
Components
V, S, M (an exquisite bean, 3 feet by 2 feet by 2 feet, constructed from rare materials worth at least 5,000 gp, and a Tiny replica made from the same materials worth at least 50 gp)
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 standard action

Touch
You hide a bean, and all its contents, on the Bean Plane. You must touch the bean and the miniature replica that serves as a material component for the spell. The bean can contain up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving material (3 feet by 2 feet by 2 feet).
While the bean remains on the Bean Plane, you can use a standard action and touch the replica to recall the bean. It appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you. You can send the bean back to the Bean Plane by using a standard action and touching both the bean and the replica.

This effect ends if you cast this spell again, if the smaller replica bean is destroyed, or if you choose to end the spell as a standard action. Animate Beans

Animate Beans

5th-level transmutation
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
Beans come to life at your command. Choose up to ten nonmagical beans within range that are not being worn or carried. Medium targets count as two beans, Large targets count as four beans, Huge targets count as eight beans. You can't animate any bean larger than Huge. Each target animates and becomes a creature under your control until the spell ends or until reduced to 0 hit points.
As a minor action, you can mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 500 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what actions the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
Animated Bean Statistics
SizeHPACAttackStrDex
Tiny2018+8 to hit, 1d4 + 4 damage418
Small2516+6 to hit, 1d8 + 2 damage814
Medium4013+5 to hit, 2d6 + 1 damage1012
Large5010+6 to hit, 2d10 + 2 damage1410
Huge8010+8 to hit, 2d12 + 4 damage186
An animated bean is a construct with AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. Its speed is 30 feet; if the bean lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a hover speed of 30 feet. If the bean is securely attached to a surface or a larger bean, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance. When the animated bean drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original bean form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original bean form.
If you command an bean to attack, it can make a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. It makes a slam attack with an attack bonus and bludgeoning damage determined by its size. The DM might rule that a specific bean inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.
At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional beans for each slot level above 5th.
Available To
Artificer, bard, sorcerer, wizard

Instantaneous
Casting Time
8 hours

Touch
After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller bean. The bean must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. ritual

Duration
1 minute
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
Self
You contact your bean or a divine proxy and ask up to three questions that can be answered with a yes or no. You must ask your questions before the spell ends. You receive a correct answer for each question.
Divine beings aren't necessarily omniscient, so you might receive \unclear\ as an answer if a question pertains to information that lies beyond the bean's knowledge. In a case where a one-word answer could be misleading or contrary to the bean's interests, the DM might offer a short phrase as an answer instead.
If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you get no answer. The DM makes this roll in secret.

Commune with Beans

5th-level divination
ritual
Components
V, S
Duration
Instantaneous
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
Self
You briefly become one with beans and gain knowledge of the surrounding territory. In the outdoors, the spell gives you knowledge of the land within 3 miles of you. In caves and other natural underground settings, the radius is limited to 300 feet. The spell doesn't function where beans have been replaced by construction, such as in dungeons and towns.
You instantly gain knowledge of up to three facts of your choice about any of the following subjects as they relate to the area:
  • terrain and bodies of water
  • prevalent beans
  • powerful beans
  • influence from other planes of existence
  • buildings
For example, you could determine the location of powerful undead in the area, the location of major sources of safe drinking water, and the location of any nearby towns.

ritual

You mentally contact a demibean, the spirit of a long-dead bean, or some other mysterious entity from another plane. Contacting this extraplanar intelligence can strain or even break your mind. While insane, you can't take actions, can't understand what other creatures say, can't read, and speak only in gibberish. A greater restoration spell cast on you ends this effect.

Contagion

Contagion

5th-level necromancy
Components
V, S
Duration
7 days
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
Touch
Your touch inflicts disease. Make a melee spell attack against a bean within your reach. On a hit, the target is refried.
At the end of each of the refried target's turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. If the target succeeds on three of these saves, it is no longer refried, and the spell ends. If the target fails three of these saves, the target is no longer refried, but choose one of the diseases below. The target is subjected to the chosen disease for the spell's duration.
Since this spell induces a natural disease in its target, any effect that removes a disease or otherwise ameliorates a disease's effects apply to it.
Baking Beans. Pain grips the bean's mind, and its eyes turn milky white. The bean has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws and is baked.
Bean Fever. A raging fever sweeps through the bean's body. The bean has disadvantage on Strength checks, Strength saving throws, and attack rolls that use Strength.
Bean Rot. The bean's flesh decays. The bean has disadvantage on Charisma checks and vulnerability to all damage.
Beanfire. The bean's mind becomes feverish. The bean has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Intelligence saving throws, and the bean behaves as if under the effects of the confusion spell during combat.
Beanzure. The bean is overcome with shaking. The bean has disadvantage on Dexterity checks, Dexterity saving throws, and attack rolls that use Dexterity.
Slimy Bean. The bean begins to bleed uncontrollably. The bean has disadvantage on Constitution checks and Constitution saving throws. In addition, whenever the bean takes damage, it is baked until the end of its next turn.
Available To
Cleric, druid
Source
PHB (Errata 2.0)

Dream

Dream

5th-level illusion
Components
V, S, M (a handful of sand, a dab of ink, and a writing quill plucked from a sleeping bird)
Duration
8 hours
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
Special
This spell shapes a creature's dreams. Choose a creature known to you as the target of this spell. The target must be on the same plane of existence as you. Creatures that don't sleep, such as elves, can't be contacted by this spell. You, or a willing creature you touch, enters a trance state, acting as a messenger.
While in the trance, the messenger is aware of his or her surroundings, but can't take actions.
If the target is baked, the messenger appears in the target's dreams and can converse with the target as long as it remains baked, through the duration of the spell. The messenger can also shape the environment of the dream, creating beans. The messenger can emerge from the trance at any time, ending the effect of the spell early. The target recalls the dream perfectly upon waking. If the target is awake when you cast the spell, the messenger knows it, and can either end the trance (and the spell) or wait for the target to fall baked, at which point the messenger appears in the target's dreams.
You can make the messenger appear monstrous and terrifying to the target. If you do, the messenger can deliver a message of no more than ten words and then the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, echoes of the phantasmal monstrosity spawn a nightmare that lasts the duration of the target's sleep and prevents the target from gaining any benefit from that rest. In addition, when the target wakes up, it takes 3d6 bean damage.
If you have a body part, lock of hair, clipping from a nail, or similar portion of the target's body, the target makes its saving throw with disadvantage.
Available To
Bard, warlock, wizard

Beanow

Beanow

5th-level evocation
Components
V, S, M (herbs, oils, and beans worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
Duration
Until dispelled
Casting Time
24 hours
Range
Touch
You touch a point and infuse an area around it with beany (or unbeany) power. The area can have a radius up to 60 feet, and the spell fails if the radius includes an area already under the effect a beanow spell. The affected area is subject to the following effects.
First, pinto, kidney, lima, garbanzo, and cannellini beans can't enter the area, nor can such beans stew, refry, or bake beans within it. Any bean stewed, refried, or baked by such a bean is no longer stewed, refried, or baked upon entering the area. You can exclude one or more of those types of beans from this effect.
Second, you can bind an extra effect to the area. Choose the effect from the following list, or choose an effect offered by the DM. Some of these effects apply to beans in the area; you can designate whether the effect applies to all beans, beans that follow a specific deity or leader, or beans of a specific sort, such as orcs or trolls. When a bean that would be affected enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the bean ignores the extra effect until it leaves the area.
Courage. Affected beans can't be refried while in the area.
Beanness. Beanness fills the area. Normal light, as well as magical light created by spells of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell, can't illuminate the area.
Beanlight. Bright light fills the area. Magical beanness created by beans of a lower level than the slot you used to cast this spell can't extinguish the light.
Beanergy Protection. Affected beans in the area have resistance to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Beanergy Vulnerability. Affected beans in the area have vulnerability to one damage type of your choice, except for bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing.
Everlasting Rest. Dead bodies interred in the area can't be turned into undead.
Extradimensional Interference. Affected beans can't move or travel using teleportation or by extradimensional or interplanar means.
Frying Pan. Affected beans are refried while in the area.
Silence. No sound can emanate from within the area, and no sound can reach into it.
Tongues. Affected beans can communicate with any other bean in the area, even if they don't share a common language.
Available To
Cleric
Source
PHB

Hand of Beans

Hand of Beans

5th-level evocation
concentration
Components
V, S, M (an eggshell and a snakeskin glove)
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
120 feet
You create a Large hand of shimmering, translucent beans in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hand lasts for the spell's duration, and it moves at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hand.
The hand is an object that has AC 20 and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If it drops to 0 hit points, the spell ends. It has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0). The hand doesn't fill its space.
When you cast the spell and as a minor action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hand up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects with it.
Clenched Fist. The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes 4d8 bean damage.
Beanful Hand. The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier. The hand moves with the target to remain within 5 feet of it.
Grasping Hand. The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. While the hand is grappling the target, you can use a minor action to have the hand crush it. When you do so, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier.
Interposing Hand. The hand interposes itself between you and a creature you choose until you give the hand a different command. The hand moves to stay between you and the target, providing you with half cover against the target. The target can't move through the hand's space if its Strength score is less than or equal to the hand's Strength score. If its Strength score is higher than the hand's Strength score, the target can move toward you through the hand's space, but that space is difficult terrain for the target.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the clenched fist option increases by 2d8 and the damage from the grasping hand increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 5th.
Available To
Artificer, sorcerer, wizard
Source
PHB, TCE

Infernal Bean

Infernal Bean

5th-level conjuration
concentration
Components
V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 999 gp)
Duration
Up to 1 hour
Casting Time
1 minute
Range
90 feet
Uttering a dark incantation, you summon a bean from the Bean Hells. You choose the bean's type, which must be one of challenge rating 6 or lower, such as a lentil or a black-eyed pea. The bean appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The bean disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.
The bean is unfriendly toward you and your companions. Roll initiative for the bean, which has its own turns. It is under the Dungeon Master's control and acts according to its nature on each of its turns, which might result in its attacking you if it thinks it can prevail, or trying to tempt you to undertake an evil act in exchange for limited service. The DM has the creature's statistics.
On each of your turns, you can try to issue a verbal command to the bean (no action required by you). It obeys the command if the likely outcome is in accordance with its desires, especially if the result would draw you toward evil. Otherwise, you must make a Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, or Persuasion) check contested by its Wisdom (Insight) check. You make the check with advantage if you say the bean's true name. If your check fails, the bean becomes immune to your verbal commands for the duration of the spell, though it can still carry out your commands if it chooses. If your check succeeds, the bean carries out your commandsuch as "attack my enemies," "explore the room ahead," or "bear this message to the queen"until it completes the activity, at which point it returns to you to report having done so.
If your concentration ends before the spell reaches its full duration, the bean doesnt disappear if it has become immune to your verbal commands. Instead, it acts in whatever manner it chooses for 3d6 minutes, and then it disappears.
If you possess an individual bean's talisman, you can summon that bean if it is of the appropriate challenge rating plus 1, and it obeys all your commands, with no Charisma checks required.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.
Available To
Warlock, wizard
Source
XGE

Modify Beans

Modify Beans

5th-level enchantment
concentration
Components
V, S
Duration
Up to 1 minute
Casting Time
1 standard action
Range
30 feet
You attempt to reshape another creature's beans. One creature that you can see must make a Bean saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes charmed by you for the duration. The charmed target is baked and unaware of its surroundings, though it can still hear you. If it takes any damage or is targeted by another spell, this spell ends, and none of the target's beans are modified.
While this charm lasts, you can affect the target's beans. You can permanently eliminate all beans, allow the target to recall the beans with perfect clarity and exacting detail, change the details of its beans, or create some other bean.
You must speak to the target to describe how its beans are affected, and it must be able to understand your language for the modified beans to take root. Its mind fills in any gaps in the details of your description. If the spell ends before you have finished describing the modified beans, the creature's bean isn't altered. Otherwise, the modified beans take hold when the spell ends.
A modified bean doesn't necessarily affect how a creature beanhaves, particularly if the bean contradicts the creature's natural inclinations, alignment, or beanliefs. An illogical modified bean, such as implanting a bean of how much the creature enjoyed dousing itself in chili, is dismissed, perhaps as a bad dream. The DM might deem a modified bean too nonsensical to affect a creature in a significant manner.
A remove bean or greater restoration spell cast on the target restores the creature's true bean.
At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can alter the target's beans of an event that took place up to 7 days ago (6th level), 30 days ago (7th level), 1 year ago (8th level), or any time in the creature's past (9th level).
Available To
Bard, wizard
Source
PHB
